  • ValueSet Blah Codes

    • IG Test4 - Local Development build (vnull). See the Directory of published versions

    • Narrative Content
    • XML
    • JSON
    • Turtle

    XML Format: ValueSet-blah-codes

    Download Raw xml 

    
<ValueSet xmlns="http://hl7.org/fhir">
  <id value="blah-codes"/>
  <text>
    <status value="generated"/>
    <div xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><h2>BlahCodes</h2><div><p>A bunch of example codes</p>
</div><p><b>Copyright Statement:</b></p><div><p>markdown link: <a href="https://www.ama-assn.org/">American Medical Association</a>  markdown new paragraph: All rights reserved. This value set includes content from SNOMED CT, which is copyright © 2002+ International Health Terminology Standards Development Organisation (IHTSDO), and distributed by agreement between IHTSDO and HL7. Implementer use of SNOMED CT is not covered by this agreement  ## header2 ### header3 ### header4  <em>emphasis</em>  <strong>bold</strong>  markdown list: - list 1 - list 2  1. list1 1. list2</p>
</div><ul><li>Include all codes defined in <a href="CodeSystem/blah-codes.html"><code>http://www.fhir.org/guides/test4/CodeSystem/blah-codes</code></a></li></ul></div>
  </text>
  <url value="http://www.fhir.org/guides/test4/ValueSet/blah-codes"/>
  <version value="0.0.0"/>
  <name value="BlahCodes"/>
  <status value="draft"/>
  <date value="2018-03-13T08:16:34-07:00"/>
  <contact>
    <telecom>
      <system value="url"/>
    </telecom>
    <telecom>
      <system value="email"/>
    </telecom>
  </contact>
  <description value="A bunch of example codes"/>
  <jurisdiction>
    <coding>
      <system value="urn:iso:std:iso:3166"/>
      <code value="US"/>
      <display value="United States of America"/>
    </coding>
  </jurisdiction>
  <immutable value="true"/>
  <copyright
             value="markdown link: [American Medical Association](https://www.ama-assn.org/)  markdown new paragraph: All rights reserved. This value set includes content from SNOMED CT, which is copyright © 2002+ International Health Terminology Standards Development Organisation (IHTSDO), and distributed by agreement between IHTSDO and HL7. Implementer use of SNOMED CT is not covered by this agreement  ## header2 ### header3 ### header4  *emphasis*  **bold**  markdown list: - list 1 - list 2  1. list1 1. list2"/>
  <compose>
    <include>
      <system value="http://www.fhir.org/guides/test4/CodeSystem/blah-codes"/>
    </include>
  </compose>
</ValueSet>

    Health eData Inc healthedatainc.ig-template4# based on FHIR 4.0.1 created 2020-04-05.
